item.title: Rachael add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Rachael add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Nicolas Chamfort
item.description: "A day without laughter is a day wasted." -- Nicolas Chamfort

item.title: Rachael add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description: "Ask not what your country can do for you; ask what you can do for your country." -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "The love of learning, the sequestered nooks, And all the sweet serenity of books" -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Confucious
item.description: "Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life." -- Confucious

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "Death ends a life, not a relationship." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "All endings are also beginnings. We just don't know it at the time." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "Accept who you are; and revel in it." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "Life is a series of pulls back and forth... A tension of opposites, like a pull on a rubber band. Most of us live somewhere in the middle. A wrestling match...Which side win? Love wins. Love always wins" -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Arnold Lobel
item.description: "Books to the ceiling, Books to the sky, My pile of books is a mile high. How I love them! How I need them! I'll have a long beard by the time I read them." -- Arnold Lobel

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description:
"And on the subject of burning books: I want to congratulate librarians, not famous for their physical strength or their powerful political connections or their great wealth, who, all over this country, have staunchly resisted anti-democratic bullies who have tried to remove certain books from their shelves, and have refused to reveal to thought police the names of persons who have checked out those titles.
So the America I loved still exists, if not in the White House or the Supreme Court or the Senate or the House of Representatives or the media. The America I love still exists at the front desks of our public libraries." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "Silence is sometimes the best answer" -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "We are visitors on this planet. We are here for one hundred years at the very most. During that period we must try to do something good, something useful, with our lives. if you contribute to other people's happiness, you will find the true meaning of life." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Hillary Rodham Clinton
item.description: "In the bible it says you have to forgive seventy times seven. I want you all to know, I'm keeping a chart." -- Hillary Rodham Clinton

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Caroline Norton
item.description: "We have been friends together in sunshine and shade." -- Caroline Norton

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "For you, a thousand times over" -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Rachael add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Rachael add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Rachael add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "A person is, among all else, a material thing, easily torn and not easily mended." -- Ian McEwan
